subject: Re: [junit] No tests found warning in ecilpse test runner
msgSnippet: Make the base class abstract. That should do the trick, Hope this helps, /Joakim Ohlrogge ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Make the base class abstract. That should do the trick,
Hope this helps,
/Joakim Ohlrogge

On 7/25/06, amit_mendelson2002 <amitm@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> During work, I've encountered the following problem:
> We defined a base class, joint for some test classes. The base class
> has no tests, but it inherits from testCase.
> The base class has some sub-classes, which contain tests.
>
> When running in eclipse, the testrunner complains it has no tests (it
> throws an AssertionFailedError: No tests foundï¿½).
>
> I'll be very grateful for any help.
>
> Amit
>
>
>
